=== General Community News ===

==== Ubuntu Membership Boards Call for Nominations ====

Providing a brief reminder of what Ubuntu Membership shows, the Community Council is seeking nominations for the Membership Boards, which review and evaluate potential Ubuntu members. Details of what is required of applicants, and how to nominate are given.

http://fridge.ubuntu.com/2020/11/03/ubuntu-membership-boards-call-for-nominations/

Congratulations to these contributors!

=== The Hub ===

==== Ubucon Asia 2021 - Looking for organizers ====

Youngbin Han of the Ubuntu Korean Lo``Co is trying to organize a virtual conference with other Lo``Cos in the Asia region, and is seeking help to organize Ubu``Con Asia 2021. Youngbin has provided some details, and associates need not be from the Asian region to help.

https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/ubucon-asia-2021-looking-for-organizers/19172

==== Hirsute Hippo Draft Release Notes ====

Iain Laney has provided a template of what will become the Ubuntu 20.10 (currently Hirsute Hippo) release. More detail will be provided as it is known.

https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/hirsute-hippo-draft-release-notes/19221

==== Restaffing ====

Martin Wimpress reminds us that all positions in Ubuntu Governance Body (Council or Board) have a defined role and term (with one noted exception).  This document provides details on the nomination, appointment, confirmation, announcements, and other steps that must be followed and applied during the related term.

https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/restaffing/890

=== In the Blogosphere ===

==== LXQt 0.16.0 Desktop Environment Released with Three New Themes, Many Improvements ====

Marius Nestor alerts us to the release of LXQt 0.16.0 with many fixes and improvements. Included are new themes, notifications, plus better support for Bluetooth audio devices. Numerous other new features are mentioned, with links provided.

https://9to5linux.com/lxqt-0-16-0-desktop-environment-released-with-three-new-themes-many-improvements

==== Ubuntu Touch OTA-14 Released with Better Support for Volla Phone, More Android 9 Devices ====

Marius Nestor tells us that UBports have released the Ubuntu Touch OTA-14 for Linux smartphones and tablets. It improves support for Android 9 devices especially the shipping-soon Volla Phone. Listing many of the improvements in this release, he tells us we should be able to update to it in the coming days by following provided instruction if we have a supported device. Links are provided.

https://9to5linux.com/ubuntu-touch-ota-14-released-with-better-support-for-volla-phone-android-9-devices

==== Ubuntu Security Podcast: Episode 95 ====

"This week we look at vulnerabilities in Samba, GDM, Accounts``Service, GOsa and more, plus we cover some App``Armor related Ubuntu Security community updates as well."

https://ubuntusecuritypodcast.org/episode-95/

==== Ubuntu Podcast from the UK LoCo: S13E33 – New shoes on the table ====

"This week we’ve been hacking Steam controllers and making fast home directories. We round up the Ubuntu community news, discuss the 21.04 codename, Raspberry Pi images for Ubuntu MATE, Trisquel 9.0, snap speed improvements and turn our lights on and off from GNOME Shell. We also round up some news from the rest of the tech world."

https://ubuntupodcast.org/2020/11/05/s13e33-new-shoes-on-the-table/

=== Get Involved ===

The Ubuntu community consists of individuals and teams, working on different aspects of the distribution, giving advice and technical support, and helping to promote Ubuntu to a wider audience. No contribution is too small, and anyone can help. It's your chance to get in on all the community fun associated with developing and promoting Ubuntu. More on this at: https://community.ubuntu.com/contribute/

Or get involved with the Ubuntu Weekly Newsletter team! We always need summary writers and editors, if you're interested, learn more at: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuWeeklyNewsletter/Join

=== Feedback ===

This document is maintained by the Ubuntu Weekly News Team. If you have a story idea or suggestions for the Weekly Newsletter, join the Ubuntu News Team mailing list at https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/Ubuntu-news-team and submit it. Ideas can also be added to the wiki at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuWeeklyNewsletter/Ideas. If you'd like to contribute to a future issue of the Ubuntu Weekly Newsletter, please feel free to edit the appropriate wiki page. If you have any technical support questions, please check https://community.ubuntu.com/help-information/ for more information on where to get help.
